result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damond Gabriel Cox

defendant.name: Cox, Damond Gabriel
defendant.address: 1330 North Milwaukee Avenue, Upper, South Milwaukee, WI 53172

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Damond Gabriel Cox in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Damond Gabriel Cox.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for for a scheduling conference. Defense received discovery and an offer. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to allow time to go over materials and offer with client and to determine case posture. Court grants requests and adjourns matter for a status conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Damond Gabriel Cox appeared by video.  Attorney Connor Romenesko appeared by video for Damond Gabriel Cox.  Prosecuting Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of 07CF281. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: South Milwaukee Officer L. Staege. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 11.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Damond Gabriel Cox in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Swanson, Branch 11.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/17/2022@1pm
